title: Basics of Data Analytics and Metrics for Timor-Leste

questions.question: What are the four main types of data analytics mentioned in the course?
choices: Descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive analytics
Qualitative, quantitative, exploratory, and confirmatory analytics
Primary, secondary, tertiary, and quaternary analytics
Nominal, ordinal, interval, and ratio analytics
questions.answer: Descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive analytics

questions.question: What does the SMART criteria stand for in the context of defining effective metrics?
choices: Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound
Simple, Meaningful, Actionable, Reliable, Timely
Strategic, Manageable, Attainable, Realistic, Trackable
Significant, Motivating, Adaptable, Responsive, Targeted

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a source of data in the course?
choices: Focus groups
Surveys
Observations
Existing databases

questions.question: What are the four critical dimensions of data quality discussed in the course?
choices: Accuracy, completeness, consistency, and timeliness
Relevance, reliability, replicability, and robustness
Precision, validity, variability, and volume
Clarity, conciseness, coherence, and credibility

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of descriptive statistics?
choices: Mean
Hypothesis testing
P-value
Regression analysis

questions.question: What is the primary focus of the final session in the course?
choices: Interpreting analytical results and effectively communicating findings
Data collection methods and data quality
Key performance indicators and metrics
Advanced statistical analysis techniques
questions.answer: Interpreting analytical results and effectively communicating findings

questions.question: What is the main assessment component of the course?
choices: A comprehensive final project
A series of quizzes and exams
A research paper on data analytics in Timor-Leste
A group presentation on a chosen topic

questions.question: How does the course ensure contextual relevance to Timor-Leste?
choices: By using examples, datasets, and practical exercises tailored to the Timorese context
By inviting guest speakers from Timorese organizations
By conducting field trips to local businesses and government agencies
By providing course materials in Tetum language
questions.answer: By using examples, datasets, and practical exercises tailored to the Timorese context

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a Timor-Leste-specific element in the course?
choices: Analyzing economic indicators of Timor-Leste
Comparing data analytics practices in Timor-Leste with other Southeast Asian countries
Discussing the history of data analytics in Timor-Leste
Examining the role of international organizations in promoting data analytics in Timor-Leste

questions.question: What is the primary aim of the project-based learning approach in the course?
choices: To ensure that students can immediately apply their skills to real-world scenarios in Timor-Leste
To encourage students to pursue further studies in data analytics
To prepare students for international data analytics competitions
To help students secure job opportunities in multinational corporations
questions.answer: To ensure that students can immediately apply their skills to real-world scenarios in Timor-Leste
